target_text: "OK, great. Software quality is the end result. It has a structural perspective which is the code and the design. It has also an external component which is free of defects and meets the end user requirements."

Role.Subject: Geography
Role.positionality: As a Product Owner with a Master's level education in Geography, my research interests lie at the intersection of economic systems and spatial dynamics. I aim to explore how geographical factors influence economic outcomes, particularly in urban settings. However, I recognize that my epistemological assumptions may shape my interpretations, potentially leading me to prioritize quantitative data over qualitative insights. This positionality influences my research by framing my questions and analysis through a lens that may overlook alternative perspectives. By acknowledging these dimensions, I strive to approach my work with greater reflexivity, ensuring a more comprehensive understanding of the complex interplay between geography and economics.

codebook.justification: The phrase [Software quality is the end result] highlights the subjective nature of defining quality, which varies across contexts and stakeholders.

The term [structural perspective which is the code and the design] emphasizes the importance of design and architecture in software quality, reflecting varying interpretations in software engineering.
The phrase [meets the end user requirements] indicates that quality is contingent on user satisfaction, which is inherently subjective and context-dependent.
The concept of [free of defects] suggests a standard of quality that is often debated, as what constitutes a defect can differ among users and developers.
